members.name: needsGui
members.comment: Determines whether this bean needs a GUI.

return: True if the bean absolutely needs a GUI available in order to get its work done.

members.name: dontUseGui
members.comment: This method instructs the bean that it should not use the Gui.

members.name: okToUseGui
members.comment: This method instructs the bean that it is OK to use the Gui.

members.name: avoidingGui
members.comment: Determines whether this bean is avoiding using a GUI.

return: true if the bean is currently avoiding use of the Gui. e.g. due to a call on dontUseGui().

name: java.beans.Visibility
comment:
Under some circumstances a bean may be run on servers where a GUI is not available. This interface can be used to query a bean to determine whether it absolutely needs a gui, and to advise the bean whether a GUI is available.

This interface is for expert developers, and is not needed for normal simple beans. To avoid confusing end-users we avoid using getXXX setXXX design patterns for these methods.
